pylapp.smoothclicker.android.views

Class ItClickerActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • pylapp.smoothclicker.android.AbstractTest
      • pylapp.smoothclicker.android.views.ItClickerActivity

  • public class ItClickerActivity
extends AbstractTest
    Class to use to make UI tests with UIAutomator and Espresso of the ClickerActivity.
    Since:
    11/04/2016
    Version:
    1.2.0
    Author:
    pylapp
    See Also:
    AbstractTest

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeDelayOnSwitchChanges()
      Test if the switch changes (for the start type) modifies well the delay field If the switch for the start type is ON, the delay field is enabled.
      void changeRepeatOnCheckboxChanges()
      Test if the endless repeat checkbox changes modifies well the repeat field If the check box for the endless repeat is checked, the repeat field is disabled If the check box for the endless repeat is unchecked, the repeat field is enabled
      void clean() 
      void clickCleanAll()
      Test the click on the button for the "clean all" feature If the button to clean all is clicked, the configuration / values ion the fields have to be the default values, and the list of points has to be cleaned If the button to clean all is clicked and no values has been changed, the values still remain the default ones
      void clickCleanPoints()
      Test the click on the button for the "clean points" feature If the button to clean points is clicked, the list of points has to be cleaned If the button to clean points is clicked and no values has been changed, the values still remain the default ones
      void clickOnSuGrantButton()
      Deprecated. 
      private android.support.test.espresso.ViewAction clickXY(int x, int y)
      Custom ViewAction to click on dedicated coordinates
      void exitDialog()
      Tests if the back button displays the exit-pop-up If the back button is pressed on the main activity, an exit dialog is displayed If we click on the exit dialog's cancel button, we stay at this activity If we click on the exit dialog's ok button, we exit the app
      void exportConfig()
      Tests the export feature with its snackbar and its dedicated action button If the configuration is exported in the JSON files, a snackbar with a good message is displayed with an action button
      private void fillSpinnerAsUser()
      Selects some points to fill the spinner
      private static android.app.Activity getActivityInstance()
      Retrieves the on going activity
      void importConfig()
      Tests the import feature with its snackbar If the configuration is imported in the JSON files, a snackbar with a good message is displayed
      void init() 
      void longClickOnArcMenuNewPointItem()
      Tests the long clicks on the floating action button for new point in the arc menu A long click on the button to use to add points to click on should display a snackbar with an explain message
      void longClickOnArcMenuStartItem()
      Tests the long clicks on the floating action button for start in the arc menu A long click on the button to use to start the process should display a snackbar with an explain message
      void longClickOnArcMenuStopItem()
      Tests the long clicks on the floating action button for stop in the arc menu A long click on the button to use to stop the process should display a snackbar with an explain message
      void longClickOnArcMenuSuGrantItem()
      Tests the long clicks on the floating action button for SU grant in the arc menu A long click on the button to use to get the SU grant should display a snackbar with an explain message
      void selectPoints()
      Tests clicks on the select points activity and if the list of points is well populated (in the clicker activity) If a click is donne at coordinates X/Y on the dedicated activity, the main activity has to display the selected point in its spinner
      void selectPointsButton()
      Test the button for selecting points If the button to select points is clicked, the activity to select points have to be launched If in this activity we click on back, the main activity must be displayed and the previous activity finished
      void startButtonWithoutDefinedPoints()
      Test the start button without having defined clicks If the button to start the click process is clicked, and no point has been defined, a snackbar with an error message has to be displayed
      void startMainActivityFromHomeScreen()
      Starts the main activity to test from the home screen
      void stopButtonWithoutStartedProcess()
      Test the stop button without having started the process If the button to stop the click process is clicked, and no process was working, a snackbar with an error message ahs to be displayed/i>

      • changeDelayOnSwitchChanges

        public void changeDelayOnSwitchChanges()
        Test if the switch changes (for the start type) modifies well the delay field If the switch for the start type is ON, the delay field is enabled. If the switch for the start type is OFF, the delay field is disabled.

      • changeRepeatOnCheckboxChanges

        public void changeRepeatOnCheckboxChanges()
        Test if the endless repeat checkbox changes modifies well the repeat field If the check box for the endless repeat is checked, the repeat field is disabled If the check box for the endless repeat is unchecked, the repeat field is enabled

      • clickOnSuGrantButton

        @Deprecated
public void clickOnSuGrantButton()
        Deprecated. 
        Test the click on the SU grant button If the button to get the SU grant is clicked, a notification about the good access to SU grant is displayed

      • startButtonWithoutDefinedPoints

        public void startButtonWithoutDefinedPoints()
        Test the start button without having defined clicks If the button to start the click process is clicked, and no point has been defined, a snackbar with an error message has to be displayed

      • stopButtonWithoutStartedProcess

        public void stopButtonWithoutStartedProcess()
        Test the stop button without having started the process If the button to stop the click process is clicked, and no process was working, a snackbar with an error message ahs to be displayed/i>

      • selectPoints

        public void selectPoints()
        Tests clicks on the select points activity and if the list of points is well populated (in the clicker activity) If a click is donne at coordinates X/Y on the dedicated activity, the main activity has to display the selected point in its spinner

      • selectPointsButton

        public void selectPointsButton()
        Test the button for selecting points If the button to select points is clicked, the activity to select points have to be launched If in this activity we click on back, the main activity must be displayed and the previous activity finished

      • exitDialog

        public void exitDialog()
        Tests if the back button displays the exit-pop-up If the back button is pressed on the main activity, an exit dialog is displayed If we click on the exit dialog's cancel button, we stay at this activity If we click on the exit dialog's ok button, we exit the app

      • exportConfig

        public void exportConfig()
        Tests the export feature with its snackbar and its dedicated action button If the configuration is exported in the JSON files, a snackbar with a good message is displayed with an action button

      • importConfig

        public void importConfig()
        Tests the import feature with its snackbar If the configuration is imported in the JSON files, a snackbar with a good message is displayed

      • clickCleanAll

        public void clickCleanAll()
        Test the click on the button for the "clean all" feature If the button to clean all is clicked, the configuration / values ion the fields have to be the default values, and the list of points has to be cleaned If the button to clean all is clicked and no values has been changed, the values still remain the default ones

      • clickCleanPoints

        public void clickCleanPoints()
        Test the click on the button for the "clean points" feature If the button to clean points is clicked, the list of points has to be cleaned If the button to clean points is clicked and no values has been changed, the values still remain the default ones
